title: 114_hr3754
content: The "Halting Government Overreach Act of 2015" is the short title of this Act. It changes limitations on recovery of fees and expenses by the prevailing party in an action against the United States. The "Halting Government Overreach Act of 2015" amends Section 2412(d) of title 28, United States Code, by removing the substantial justification exception in civil actions against the United States. The "Halting Government Overreach Act of 2015" amends Section 2412(d) of title 28, United States Code by removing the substantial justification exception in civil actions against the United States. This change includes revising the criteria for determining fees and expenses in civil actions. The "Halting Government Overreach Act of 2015" amends Section 2412(d) of title 28, United States Code by requiring a direct and personal interest for award eligibility and excluding net worth from the definition of "party." The "Halting Government Overreach Act of 2015" amends Section 504 of title 5, United States Code by removing the substantial justification exception in agency adjudications. The "Halting Government Overreach Act of 2015" removes the substantial justification exception in agency adjudications and requires a direct and personal interest for award eligibility. The "Halting Government Overreach Act of 2015" removes net worth limitations for parties in agency adjudications initiated after the enactment of the Act.
